subject: Economics
title: The Tragedy of the Commons: When Sharing Fails
description: A 60-second lesson on The Tragedy of the Commons: When Sharing Fails.

hook.text: A shared pasture feeds 10 farmers' cows. Each farmer adds one more cow for personal profit. The pasture collapses.

buildup.text: Garrett Hardin coined the 'tragedy of the commons' in 1968.

discovery.text: Overfishing, climate change, and antibiotic resistance are all tragedies of the commons.

twist.text: Elinor Ostrom won the Nobel Prize for showing that communities CAN manage commons without government.

climax.text: The tragedy isn't inevitable. It requires either external regulation or community self-governance.

punchline.text: Shared resources work when people share the rules, not just the grass.

quiz.question: How did Elinor Ostrom challenge Hardin's view of the commons?
options: She showed communities can successfully self-govern shared resources through local rules and social norms
She advocated for privatizing all resources
